page.title: 14HUMBERFIELD QUARRY, HESSLE
page.content: Situated below the Civic Amenity Site in north-west Hessle, compacted waste is brought here from the two Civic Amenity Sites run by Humberside County Council. The waste, in this prototype disposal scheme, is stacked in the quarry and flattened by a 28 ton roller. After compaction, foundry waste from the nearby Capper Pass chemical factory is laid over the top. To keep flies and bacteria away a Landrover sprays the waste with a chemical. In addition to household rubbish, building, chemical and industrial waste are also brought here to be dumped. The council charges rates from Â£2 per load for a 30 cwt pick-up truck to Â£35 for a 4-axle compaction vehicle. It is estimated that the quarry will be totally infilled in about another fifteen years.
